channel.title: Dip Vs. Smoking
channel.description:
Alright, I am just a little curious. Half of my school does dip (including me). I have friends say that dipping is alot more safer than smoking. That made me start to think. How is "raw" tobacco against your jaw bone better than smoking a cigarette with a filter.
I want to know everyones opinion on this. If you smoke or dip, let me know, and tell me about your past experience(s)

item.title: Dip Vs. Smoking
item.dc:creator: @Skyru Skyru
item.description:
@Skyru wrote:

Well, then i’d choke and die, and you’d have to come to my funeral.

Read full topic

item.title: Dip Vs. Smoking
item.dc:creator: @classic mopmans little slave
item.description:
@classic wrote:

[quote=“Skyru, post:107, topic:435558”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=538278.msg3943744#msg3943744 date=1331660933]
My dad used to dip until he noticed little white sacks on the inside of his mouth, which happens right before you get mouth cancer, so he stopped.

I stay away from both dip and cigarettes, it’s proven that both of them can cause cancer, and I have too many family members that can’t even breath after years of smoking, and have to use oxygen and all sorts of other things, it’s not worth it.
[/quote]
Sorry to hear about your family. My grandma has breathing and heart problems, she has been in and out of the hospital for about a month or two now. She was diagnosed with diabetes about 4 years ago and the doctor recommended that she cease her smoking, but of course she didn’t listen to them. I am afraid I am going to lose her.

@Classic_ Thanks for the tip man. ;)[/quote]
No Problem, but also @

Skyru:

My health and AG teacher recommended I only dip once or twice a week.

Try to combine this to what I said, it will prove to be good for you.

Read full topic

item.title: Dip Vs. Smoking
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

[quote=“Skyru, post:110, topic:435558”]I don’t know man, I watched a video on smoking/dipping today.
The early signs of throat cancer can come within 2-3 years of using the tobacco product.
Also, dipping for a long period of time can cause hairy tongue, throat cancer, etc.
If you want to, search “Hairy tongue” on google images and then tell me what girl would want to come near you.
I’m seriously trying to kick the habbit. I may smoke every once in awhile, but once I get away from chew, i’m done for good.[/quote]

Wait until you go to the dentist and the he sprays the stuff over your teeth. You will cry, then you will quit.

Read full topic

item.title: Dip Vs. Smoking
item.dc:creator: @Skyru Skyru
item.description:
@Skyru wrote:

I don’t know man, I watched a video on smoking/dipping today.
The early signs of throat cancer can come within 2-3 years of using the tobacco product.
Also, dipping for a long period of time can cause hairy tongue, throat cancer, etc.
If you want to, search “Hairy tongue” on google images and then tell me what girl would want to come near you.
I’m seriously trying to kick the habbit. I may smoke every once in awhile, but once I get away from chew, i’m done for good.

item.title: Dip Vs. Smoking
item.dc:creator: @Recoil1 Recoil.
item.description:
@Recoil1 wrote:

[quote=“Skyru, post:7, topic:435558”][quote author=Kidpaparoach link=topic=538278.msg3937938#msg3937938 date=1331174084]

I smoke occasionally and am perfectly healthy. Only if you go insane on it and get addicted can it get bad. I find cigerettes to smell minty (strange but true). Dip sounds terribly nasty though.

You can get menthol cigs which are minty.
[/quote]
Yea, my mom has them, they are called “Menthol 100’s”
Anyways, pretty much my whole family dips, and they don’t have gum disease, rotten teeth, or any of that shit.[/quote]
You just wait bro… You think it’s fine now but it strikes later.

Read full topic

item.title: Dip Vs. Smoking
item.dc:creator: @classic mopmans little slave
item.description:
@classic wrote:

Skyru:

I’m pretty proud of myself. I haven’t dipped all weekend!

Good Job man, keep trying, like first start with two days not dipping, dip once, then try 3 days, dip once, and go on mate.

On Topic: I smoke occasionaly, I buy some of those classy cigars sometimes without the addictives, and drink a beer or two every few weeks, usually after a big exam or a holiday, and the nice cigars (looks like a long ciggy, mind you) tastes pretty nice.

Read full topic

item.title: Dip Vs. Smoking
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

Few months back an old man on an oxygen tank asked me for a cig, I told him I don’t smoke and he played it off like “oh good don’t smoke blah blah blah”

Sad thing is… the fucker couldn’t breathe and was still addicted to it… that’s now how I want to end up so I stay away from the shit. + Waste of irl gp.

Read full topic

I hurd the US has Swedish snus now, get that instead. No evidence linking it to cancer and it is far healthier than both of those alternatives (not to say that it’s good for you)

My dad used to dip until he noticed little white sacks on the inside of his mouth, which happens right before you get mouth cancer, so he stopped.

I stay away from both dip and cigarettes, it’s proven that both of them can cause cancer, and I have too many family members that can’t even breath after years of smoking, and have to use oxygen and all sorts of other things, it’s not worth it.

item.title: Dip Vs. Smoking
item.dc:creator: @Skyru Skyru
item.description:
@Skyru wrote:

[quote=“Travas, post:97, topic:435558”]hay guise
[/quote]
Holy fuck, i’m watching a video about smoking right now in health class called “Smoking: Truth or dare”
and he is in it!
I can’t believe it. When people smoke long enough, they could get throat cancer, and then have a hole in their throat… and they still attempt to smoke throught that hole!

@Chrix, Timber Wolf already had individual wrapped tobacco. It is called “Timber Wolf: Tobacco pouches”

Read full topic

item.title: Dip Vs. Smoking
item.dc:creator: @Chrix Chrix
item.description:
@Chrix wrote:

Don’t know if that has been posted but recently as of last year Marlboro and Camel released ‘Snus’ which is individually rapped chewing tobacco packs that resemble tea bags. I’ve tryed them and its not bad and I’m sure it’s a lot better than chewing tobacco without the bag.

Read full topic

item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

[quote=“krackkid, post:95, topic:435558”][quote author=Miss Silabsoft link=topic=538278.msg3940272#msg3940272 date=1331365460]

His town is huge compared to where I live, http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arcadia,_Florida Not too much to do here.

en.wikipedia.org

Holiday, Florida

Holiday is a census-designated place (CDP) in Pasco County, Florida, United States. It is a suburb of the Tampa-St. Petersburg-Clearwater, Florida Metropolitan Statistical Area. The population was 22,403 as of the 2010 census. In the early 1960s, William W. Boyd, president of First Federal Savings and Loan Association of Tarpon Springs, noted the name Holiday Drive on a map near the site of the proposed branch to be built in southwestern Pasco County and asked his board of directors to give the n...

Florida really is the ghetto of the south in some places.
[/quote]I lived in holiday for a while, my dad still lives there. US19 is the most ghetto of all always tore up.[/quote]
oh the construction thats been going on since before I was born and will continue after i die? Yeah you should really see the bottleneck they created at 19 and Drew(maybe further up I forgot) going from three lanes then back to two lanes then back to three. All that time spent added a third lane to decrease traffic problems effectively destroyed. I would take McMullen booth when it comes to traveling north or south in that area except I always get speeding tickets on that road.
